meanings.definition: To discount (a negotiable instrument) a second time.
meanings.sent1: She rediscounts the check to get more money.
meanings.sent2: He often rediscounts his old CDs to buy new ones.
meanings.sent3: The magician rediscounts the same trick to impress the audience.
meanings.sent4: The teacher rediscounts the lesson to ensure everyone understands.
meanings.sent5: The chef rediscounts the recipe to make it even more delicious.

meanings.definition: A discount or reduction in the price of a bill of exchange.
meanings.sent1: The store offered a rediscount on the expensive watch.
meanings.sent2: She received a rediscount on the bulk purchase of office supplies.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rediscount at the checkout made her smile.
meanings.sent4: The rediscount on the concert tickets made them sell out quickly.
meanings.sent5: The rediscount on the car made it a great deal for him.
